sections.content: This lesson introduces Wizards as a tool for simplifying record creation.
The goal is not to cover every advanced capability of Wizards, but to show:

items: Why Wizards exist
When they are useful
How they differ from the standard record creation screen

sections.content: This lesson uses a **Quotes Wizard** as a practical example.

By default, creating a record in the CRM means using the standard Create Record screen. Depending on the module, this screen can display a large number of fields all at once. While this works, it can be overwhelming, especially for complex modules or new users.
Wizards provide an alternative way to create records by:

items: Breaking record creation into smaller, guided steps
Showing only the fields needed at each stage
Reducing mistakes and skipped fields
Allowing actions to occur during record creation

sections.content: In addition to fields, Wizards can include:

items: Custom buttons and actions
Informational text
Record lookups and searches
Automated actions like sending an email

sections.content: For this lesson, we will create a Wizard for the **Quotes module**.
The goal of this Wizard is to:

items: Focus users on the key parts of a Quote
Allow users to review quoted items clearly, and see that it's possible to create Wizards that make use of subforms
Send the Quote by email at the end of the process using automations
Complete all of this without opening the full Quote record first

sections.content: Important Demo Notes for the Class
This Wizard is designed to be launched from the **Deals module related list**.

items: The Account, Deal, and Contact fields will auto-populate
This works the same way as the standard Create screen
If the Wizard is launched outside of a Deal, these fields must be filled in manually
Wizards respect the same field logic and dependencies as normal record creation
Create a regular email template for the Quotes module
Do **not** use an Inventory email template
Wizards can only use general module email templates, not Inventory templates

sections.content: Create a new Wizard for the Quotes module.

items: The purpose of this Wizard is to make Quote creation simpler and more focused
The Wizard will contain three screens
Subject
Deal Name
Account Name
Contact Name

sections.content: This screen establishes the context of the Quote.

items: The **Quoted Items** subform
Rename the button on this screen to: **"Proceed to Address Information"**
This screen allows users to focus only on products and pricing
No extra fields or distractions are shown
Billing address fields
Shipping address fields

sections.content: Configure the button on this screen to:

items: Save the record
Send an email notification
Use the prerequisite Quotes email template
Send the email to: Contact email, Account email (if available)
Save the Wizard
Ensure it is enabled for all profiles
Modules and Fields
Quotes
Layout
Layout and Type Assignment

sections.content: Assign the Wizard as the active creation method for Quotes.

items: Open an existing Deal
Confirm: Account and Contact are populated, The Contact or Account has a valid email address
Create a Quote using the Wizard
Walk through each screen with the class
Demonstrate: Saving the Quote as a Draft, Completing the Wizard and sending the email
Wait briefly and show the received email to the class
The record was created
The email was sent
The user never had to open the full Quote form

sections.content: Briefly demonstrate features not used in the demo:

items: Can display merged field data
Useful for instructions or context during record creation
Allow insertion of pre-built widgets into Wizard screens
Can look up records based on entered data
Can be conditional based on user input

sections.content: Explain that these features enable more advanced Wizards, which may be covered later.

items: Wizards simplify complex record creation
They guide users step-by-step
They reduce errors and missed fields
They can perform actions during record creation
They are especially useful for complex modules like Quotes

sections.content: After completing this lesson, you should be able to:

items: Explain the purpose and benefits of Wizards in CRM
Understand when to use Wizards vs. standard record creation
Create a basic Wizard with multiple screens
Configure Wizard screens with fields and subforms
Set up automated actions (like sending emails) within Wizards
Assign Wizards as the default creation method for a module
Recognize additional Wizard features (text components, widgets, queries)
Launch Wizards from related lists with auto-populated fields
